level.heading: BUSINESS CORPORATIONS[COLON] DISSOLUTION BY INCORPORATORS OR INITIAL DIRECTORS§ 17-737)

level.text: In addition to the requirements of Chapter 3 (Business Corporations) of the Act (D.C. Official Code § 29-301.01 et seq. (2011 Repl.)), a majority of the incorporators or initial directors of a corporation may dissolve the corporation if:
The incorporators or initial directors have not filed a biennial report by the deadline; and
The corporation is in good standing in the District before filing its articles of dissolution with the Superintendent.
